What is a SmartPixel?

Click here to learn more about your SmartPixel. For example, why your SmartPixel will not affect page load times.

How do I activate my SmartPixel?

Your SmartPixel activates automatically when you add it to your website. You’ll know that your SmartPixel is active by going to the Audiences tab of your dashboard. If All Visitors has begun populating, this means that your SmartPixel has activated.

Activating your SmartPixel, in 3 steps

1. Copy your SmartPixel from your dashboard (by clicking on the "SmartPixel Inactive" button in the right sidebar).

2. Paste it in the HTML of your website right above the end </body> tag or in the global footer.

3. (Optional) Uncomment the adroll_email for cross-device targeting. Click here to learn more.

Do you have instructions by platform?

We’ve compiled instructions for platforms that we know of, here.

If your platform is not listed and you are not sure how to add it to your website, search your platform’s support documentation. Instructions differ from platform to platform, but searching for information using one of the following terms usually turns up results:

  • Footer or footer template
  • Theme or theme template
  • Custom HTML
  • Custom Javascript
  • Adding analytics
  • Adding code

If that doesn’t work, reach out to your platform’s support team (they’ll know better than us). Finally, if you have some time, let us know the name of your platform and how you did it!

Does my SmartPixel need to fire on every page of my website?

Technically no, but we recommend that it does as a best practice. If your Smartpixel is not firing on a page, then we are not capturing any activity on that page. If you place your SmartPixel as instructed, you should only need to place it once for it to fire across every page of your website.

If you have an online shop, make sure that your SmartPixel is also active on your cart or checkout pages. For some shops, checkout occurs on a different domain (www.thisisyourdomain.com) than store pages, if so you’ll need add your SmartPixel to those pages separately. If you do not do this, we will not be able to target your highest intent segment (cart) or know when someone successfully completes a purchase.

Why isn’t my SmartPixel working?

If you’ve added your SmartPixel to your website and there seems to be a problem, click here for troubleshooting help.
